Posts.Content: Jul 12, 2012 10:33AM stacyk wrote: I had my BMX w/immediate DIEP reconstruction on May 22. I have my up and down days. Some days I feel great (not all day, but part of the day) and other days I feel crappy all day long. One thing that has recently come up is PAIN in my arms. I didn't have it until about 2 weeks ago - and now I can't stand it. I wake up in the morning in tears, because it hurts so bad. It feels like I played football all night. Any suggestions? Does anyone else have this?? Help. I can't stand the pain.

Posts.Content: Jun 1, 2012 02:42PM - edited Jun 1, 2012 02:42PM by stacyk Gamma -I am impressed. I had my surgery the same day as you and am just now getting up to use the computer. I had a bmx with immediate DIEP reconstruction. I spent 7 days in the hospital (first 2 in ICU) - and I am home recovering. I had no idea it would be this painful...and the drains are a pain!!! Although on a good note, I just got the 3rd one out today with only one left (I'm hoping will be out Monday!) I appreciate everyone's lists of things to have at the hospital, etc... I used those lists and you were all right! Happy Recovery to all...
